metadata.Title: CVE-2017-13730 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
There is an illegal address access in the function _nc_read_entry_source() in progs/tic.c in ncurses 6.0 that might lead to a remote denial of service attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-13730` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lib32ncurses6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib32ncursesw6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib32tinfo6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib64ncurses6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib64ncursesw6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib64tinfo6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libncurses5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libncurses6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libncursesw5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libncursesw6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libtinfo5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libtinfo6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-base - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-bin - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-examples - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-term - 6.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ncurses package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1-1ubuntu1').
